remarks: Given atoms ` P ` in ` X ` and ` Q ` not in ` X ` , there exists an atom ` r ` not in ` X ` such that the line ` Q .\/ r ` intersects ` X ` at ` P ` .  (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-2012.)
statement:
atbtwn.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
atbtwn.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
atbtwn.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
atbtwn.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
atbtwnex $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ P e. A /\ Q e. A ) /\ ( X e. B /\ P .<_ X /\ -. Q .<_ X ) ) -> E. r e. A ( r =/= Q /\ -. r .<_ X /\ P .<_ ( Q .\/ r ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ r $.
$d A r $.
$d B r $.
$d K r $.
$d P r $.
$d Q r $.
$d X r $.
